data.meta_description: Public Notification - Regulation of Street Vending - Greater ...
data.text: MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OF HYDERABAD PUBLIC NOTIFICATION Date: 21.6.2006 Sub:- MCH – Policy on Simplification of Regulation of Street Vending / Hawking in MCH area – Notified – Regarding. *** 1. The general public are hereby informed that the Govt. of Andhra Pradesh have issued orders regarding the policy of “Simplification of regulation of Street Vending / Hawking in Urban Areas” (vide G.O.Ms.No.398, M.A., Dt:25.9.04) in pursuance of National Policy of Urban Street Vendors. The basic objective of the said policy is to reform the licensing system for Street Vendors so that they are able to pursue their livelihood without harassment. In addition to this, the possible social cost that these occupations of street vending and hawking entail such as street congestion, lack of sanitation and hygiene and deterioration of law and order and security have also been given emphasis in framing this policy. 2. The Policy is aimed at the mobile street vendors and hawkers in the city. Street vendors or Hawkers include: ??Mobile vendors moving from place to place trading by carrying commodities / articles on head, topudu bandi, cycle, rickshaw etc., who are called differently in different areas. ??Those who do not trade from a specific / static place continuously and move from place to place based on local demand and community needs from time to time. ??Vendors who carry their activities intermittently in different places. ??Festival / special occasions vendors ??Weekly fairs – vendors. 3. This policy does not cover: ??Stationary or static vendors with permanent / semi permanent structures including bunks undertaking business on regular basis. ??Street side vending by established / licensed / organized business houses and traders. ??Those carrying dangerous and offensive trades. 4. The system provides for dividing Urban area into 3 Zones as follows: The division into Green, Amber and Red categories may vary with time of day, the day of the week and shall be revised periodically. (i) Free Zone / Green vending area – areas where street vending is allowed without restrictions. (ii) Restricted Zone / Amber vending area – area where vending is permitted on specific days and or time and or by trade. (iii)Prohibited Zone/ Red vending area – area where no street vending is permitted. - 1 -
